item.title: Deterritorialized House - Inhabiting the data center, 2014 sketches... | #data #decenter #housing - fabric | rblg
item.description:
Deterritorialized House - Inhabiting the data center, 2014 sketches... | #data #decenter #housing - fabric | rblg

What is happening when you combine a fully deterritorialized program (super or hyper-modern, "non lieu", ...) with the one of the home? What might it say or comment about contemporary living?

item.title: Etapes issue 221: Médias & design graphique | #deterritorialized - fabric | rblg
item.description:
Etapes issue 221: Médias & design graphique | #deterritorialized - fabric | rblg

Note: w e didn't found enough time last December to document an interview of fabric | ch that was publish in the French design magazine Étapes. So let's do it in early 2015... The magazine itself has been recently revamped under the direction of a new editorial board.

item.title: Design research: I&IC - Inhabiting & Interfacing the Clouds | #datacenter #cloud #infrastructure - fabric | rblg
item.description:
Design research: I&IC - Inhabiting & Interfacing the Clouds | #datacenter #cloud #infrastructure - fabric | rblg

I'm very happy to write that after several months of preparation, I'm leading a new design-research (that follows Variable Environment, dating back from 2007!) for the University of Art & design, Lausanne (ECAL), in partnership with Nicolas Nova (HEAD).

item.title: Desierto Issue #3 - 28° Celsius is out! Deterritorialized Living included | #atmosphere - fabric | rblg
item.description:
Desierto Issue #3 - 28° Celsius is out! Deterritorialized Living included | #atmosphere - fabric | rblg

28° Celsius is the temperature at which protection becomes superfluous. It is also the temperature at which swimming pools are acclimatised. Within the limits of the this hygrothermal comfort zone, we do not require the intervention of our body's thermoregulatory mechanisms nor that of any external artificial thermal controls in order to feel pleasantly comfortable while carrying out a sedentary activity without clothing.

item.title: Back from Summer | #backindeed - fabric | rblg
item.description:
Back from Summer | #backindeed - fabric | rblg

We've been working on a new publication for the magazine PAPER / Architectural Histamine about the project Deterritorialized Living, that has just been published, an interview for ETAPES: design & cultures visuelles magazine and we've also been invited to work on two competitions (invitations & deadlines during deep Summer are always most welcome...).

item.title: Deterritorialized Living (Air, Daylight, Time) in Pau | #atmosphere #data - fabric | rblg
item.description:
Deterritorialized Living (Air, Daylight, Time) in Pau | #atmosphere #data - fabric | rblg

The project, which consists in an "artificial troposphere" that reverses our causal relationship to the rythms of day and night, air, seasons, time -- based on real time global network activity by both humans and robots and that is delivered in the form of open data feeds, fictional data in some ways -- was displayed accompanied by videos of former projects by fabric | ch.

item.title: fabric | ch, Satellite Daylight, 46°28'N @ Haus für elektronische Künste | #architecture #interaction - fabric | rblg
item.description:
fabric | ch, Satellite Daylight, 46°28'N @ Haus für elektronische Künste | #architecture #interaction - fabric | rblg

For our own documentation, published a year ago in the context of the exhibition Sensing Place at the Haus für elektronische Künste in Basel, the video is a short presentation of Satellite Daylight, 46°28'N.

item.title: fabric | ch new project: a geo-engineered troposphere in the form of open data feeds (@Close_Closer) - fabric | rblg
item.description:
fabric | ch new project: a geo-engineered troposphere in the form of open data feeds (@Close_Closer) - fabric | rblg

Deterritorialized Living is a new project by fabric | ch that we've just published online last week, in relation with the Call and the Talks we are presenting during Close, Closer, the 3rd Lisbon Architecture Triennale curated by Beatrice Galilee (first talk is today, September, 21 at 5pm, LX Factory, Rua Rodrigues Faria, Lisbon, while the second one will be on December, 14).

item.title: fabric | ch at Close, Closer - Lisbon Architecture Triennale - fabric | rblg
item.description:
fabric | ch at Close, Closer - Lisbon Architecture Triennale - fabric | rblg

We are glad to announce that we'll be taking part with an Associated Project to the next Lisbon Architecture Triennale ( Close, Closer, cur. Beatrice Galilee) that will take place between September 12 and December 15, 2013.

item.title: Open call by fabric | ch & TASML: Deterritorialized Living / Inhabiting the Computer Cabinet - fabric | rblg
item.description:
Open call by fabric | ch & TASML: Deterritorialized Living / Inhabiting the Computer Cabinet - fabric | rblg

In collaboration with , Tsinghua Art & Sciences Research Center Media Laboratory (TASML) is pleased to announce an open call to the Tsinghua community for individuals or interdisciplinary groups of students and faculty in the fields of Architecture, Design, Art and Sciences.
